'Teiidae' is a family of lizards native to the Americas, generally known as
'whiptails'. The group includes the parthenogenic genera [[Cnemidophorus]] and
[[Aspidoscelis]], and the non-parthenogenic [[Tupinambis]]. It has over 230
member species in ten genera. [http://www.eol.org/pages/8110 eol.org]
About 75% of the species are in two dominant genera, [[Aspidoscelis]] and
[[Cnemidophorus]].
